issue.title: [R] [CI] Consider installing release from our repo + RSPM
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14541](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14541). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We don't currently test if our release binary installation catches the correct version / works / has all of the features. Same for RSPM installed packages. 

Could/should we add these to a nightly job (either an existing one like the devdocs, or create a new one) to ensure that everything has deployed ok? It could also be a crossbow job that doesn't run nightly, but we trigger manually after a release.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14541?focusedCommentId=17454040) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
It might also be good to exercise installs with some of our more finicky custom environment variables (e.g. to catch the bug that ARROW-14992 is fixing)
